content.raw: hm, I can't find the SensorManger::Update here call in World.cc.  The problem is when a model is spawn dynamically, its sensor gets pushed into SensorManager::initSensors, and they get initialized in SensorManager::Update in a different thread, but there's no guarantee that `model->LoadPlugins()` happens after its sensor has been initialized in this case without checking SensorManager::SensorsInitialized().
content.html: hm, I can't find the SensorManger::Update here call in World.cc. The problem is when a model is spawn dynamically, its sensor gets pushed into SensorManager::initSensors, and they get initialized in SensorManager::Update in a different thread, but there's no guarantee that model->LoadPlugins() happens after its sensor has been initialized in this case without checking SensorManager::SensorsInitialized().

content.raw: I have now forced the sensors to be updated once before the Worlds are run. This should guarantee that the sensor manager is initialized before any plugin is loaded.
content.html: I have now forced the sensors to be updated once before the Worlds are run. This should guarantee that the sensor manager is initialized before any plugin is loaded.

content.raw: we should probably test against the full pr2 with all sensors and plugins to eliminate the possibility of reintroducing the race condition.  (Be nice if we can construct an ad-hoc complex model with sufficiently complex links/joints/sensors/plugins that can also trigger the race condition error to make sure we don't break something here).
content.html: we should probably test against the full pr2 with all sensors and plugins to eliminate the possibility of reintroducing the race condition. (Be nice if we can construct an ad-hoc complex model with sufficiently complex links/joints/sensors/plugins that can also trigger the race condition error to make sure we don't break something here).
